https://prez.dev/description.@value: A categorization of disciplines or topics that the broad field of Earth science can be subdivided into, i.e. a listing of the Fields of Research, or subjects, to which a geoscience dataset, publication, observation/activity, or entity pertains. The vocabulary also contains relevant disciplines that intersect with the various Earth science fields, such as biological sciences and built environment and design, as well as entries related to collection and heritage management. Notations included are those from the 2020 ANZSRC listing (see History Note) or in common use in the geoscience community.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: The practice of combining geology or geostatistics with extractive metallurgy, to create a spatially or geologically based predictive model to optimize the efficiency of mineral processing plants. Geometallurgy specifically maps the 3D variability in petrophysical and mineralogical properties of an entire orebody, to define domains that require different mining and metallurgical processing techniques, to maximize recovery of the saleable product at minimum cost.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#hist.@value: Definition compiled by the Geological Survey of Western Australia (partly adapted from Wikipedia).
